title.narrative: Humanitarian response COVID19 pandemic: food, health, and emotional support in Lima, Peru

description.narrative: This project is a direct continuation of PER318. Peru continues to be severely affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, facing the highest per capita death rate in the world as of July 2021. Only 12.7% of the population have been fully vaccinated and there is growing concern about the spread of the Lambda C.37 variant. Peruvian GDP fell 11.12% in 2020, following 22 years of uninterrupted growth. As a result of COVID, a further 3.3 million new people living in poverty, 10 million people in total, or a third of the population. Lima has been one of the worst hit areas. Marginalised urban communities have severely affected due to deepening of their socio-economic vulnerabilities, lack of access to health clinics and hospitals, and insufficient medical equipment and medicines. This new four-month project will provide emergency support for four months to 240 people (95 men and 145 women) with daily meals via 8 Ollas Comunes (grassroots soup kitchens) in 2 districts of Lima, San Juan de Lurigancho and Ate to people who have fallen between the cracks and who have no income. PPE will be provided as needed. Project participants will be those families and vulnerable individuals living in poverty and extreme poverty who are not in work, nor able to earn and income, including people who are isolated due to CV19, older people and women. This project will support purchase of medicines and rehabilitation support to alleviate COVID19 symptoms and related sequels for those who cannot afford or access these. Finally, it will provide training to community and parish volunteers to be able to provide emotional support to local residents and families in need. This project takes part alongside a nationwide response by Caritas Peru, the diocese's own response, Bishop's Conference and in coordination with the Ministry of Health.
